qas.question: What can testing not completely find?
While looking for bugs, what else can testing do?
What does the software compare during testing against?
What make up the oracle during testing?

answers.text: specifications, contracts, comparable products, past versions

qas.question: Testing can identify all the defects within what?
While looking for bug, what can testing not do?

plausible_answers.text: specifications, contracts, comparable products, past versions of the same product, inferences about intended or expected purpose

qas.question: What are some things oracles include and are limited to?
What does the software contrast during testing against?

context: Although testing can determine the correctness of software under the assumption of some specific hypotheses (see hierarchy of testing difficulty below), testing cannot identify <a0_0>all the defects<a0_0/> within <b4_0>software<b4_0/>. Instead, it <a1_0><b5_0>furnishes a criticism or comparison<b5_0/><a1_0/> that compares the state and behavior of the product against <a2_0><b7_0>oracles—principles or mechanisms<b7_0/><a2_0/> by which someone might recognize a problem. These oracles may include (but are not limited to) <a3_0><b6_0>specifications, contracts, comparable products, past versions<a3_0/> of the same product, inferences about intended or expected purpose<b6_0/>, user or customer expectations, relevant standards, applicable laws, or other criteria.
